1.text: Tall flowers can stick out of the vase and look a bit off.
1.vid: /4/4d/Arrange Flowers in a Square Vase Step 1.360p.mp4

2.text: Smaller vases can look overdone with a huge bouquet.

3.text: Larger, heavier flowers might flop down to the side anyway.
3.vid: /7/7c/Arrange Flowers in a Square Vase Step 3.360p.mp4

4.text: Use tall, long-stemmed flowers to add contrast to your bouquet.
4.vid: /3/3b/Arrange Flowers in a Square Vase Step 4.360p.mp4

5.text: If you’re working with 2 to 3 flower types, spread them out.
5.vid: /8/86/Arrange Flowers in a Square Vase Step 5.360p.mp4

6.text: Use a variety of flower colors and types to make your bouquet pop.
6.vid: /6/60/Arrange Flowers in a Square Vase Step 6.360p.mp4

7.text: Large, heavy flowers may need a little help staying upright.
7.vid: /0/0b/Arrange Flowers in a Square Vase Step 7.360p.mp4

8.text: Use sprigs of myrtle, ivy, or fern as a base layer for your flowers.
8.vid: /5/5f/Arrange Flowers in a Square Vase Step 8.360p.mp4

9.text: Disguise clear vases with a large, green leaf.

10.text: Tiny square vases might be too small for flowers with long stems.
10.vid: /7/78/Arrange Flowers in a Square Vase Step 10.360p.mp4
